website_summaries.verdict: Not really for beginners, but if you can get this inexpensive aquaponics model working, it turns your betta tank into a nice  little display.
pros: Adds interest to your fish tank
Can be used with a variety of different plants
Half gallon size to give enough space for roots and fish
Very pretty and works well  for those with the skill to get the system going well
cons: The fish will still need to be fed
plant roots will not be enough to keep them happy
You also may still need to change the water often

customer_reviews.title: Don’t but
customer_reviews.text: Amazon needs to remove this product before more fish die from lack of oxygen.
customer_reviews.author: josh moore

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 Gallon is too small for a betta
customer_reviews.text: This was an impulse buy. I bought this for a new betta fish. After researching, a betta really needs at least a 2.5 gallon tank. Its a great concept but my water was continually cloudy even with a plant. Plus, I couldn't live with myself having my betta in a 0.5 gallon container. I have since upgraded to a more appropriate sized tank.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: ... it died and the store told me these are horrible for keeping fish
customer_reviews.text: The first fish I put in it died and the store told me these are horrible for keeping fish. The fish cannot breathe with the roots and get stuck. I had to get a bowl for my Beta #2. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Giles

customer_reviews.title: Bowl was definitely too small for a Betta and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bowl was definitely too small for a Betta and the rocks let tons of soot off that kept getting into the fish water. Overall not worth the price, ended up throwing away
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Letellier

customer_reviews.title: I love mine!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a bigger bowl at T.J.MAXX, because I found the one that came here was too small. I picked up a peace lily at Lowe’s and pulled the roots through the black plant holder. Finally I got a betta, moss ball, and water plant at Petsmart. I think this product is worth it, even if you decide to replace the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine

customer_reviews.title: Plants die shortly
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it. We went through three plants, including two mint plants (said to be good for aquaponics) and a peace lily. None survived more than a couple weeks. More importantly, we had to raise the container that holds the plant as there wasn't enough oxygen getting to our betta fish through the small crack between the glass water container and the plaint container.
customer_reviews.author: Daily 007

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Nope plants don't grow. Eco system is not working as described.. dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty small space and when I put the planter on ...
customer_reviews.text: My betta seemed to have a hard time breathing. It’s pretty small space and when I put the planter on top he just chilled at the waterline all the time. Was worried about his airflow so got a different tank. It’s a good idea but plant died quickly and idk not exactly the best tank...
customer_reviews.author: Carissa

customer_reviews.title: My first Betta tank
customer_reviews.text: I decided to tiptoe into the lifestyle of indoor fish care. Having previously been the keeper of a backyard pond with goldfish and dragonflies, scaling back at our smaller house seemed necessary. Two weeks into our purchase of fish tank and Betta, I am pleased with the tank. Makes me itch for more. We purchased a plant identical to the one shown on the box, but the root systems are not happy. The Betta, however, is doing well.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Robertson

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could give it a ZERO. DO NOT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: This looked like a beautiful addition to my office. I have now wasted in excess of $50 on poor defenseless Bettas that have all died. The plant and fish do not thrive as expected with this system.
customer_reviews.author: southerncharm

customer_reviews.title: The small cylinder they give you makes me sad.
customer_reviews.text: I'm putting the top on a larger vase. The small cylinder they give you makes me sad.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Durkin

customer_reviews.title: The more I read on this, the more I ...
customer_reviews.text: The more I read on this, the more I realized it wouldn't work. And it didn't--fish need more space and air.
customer_reviews.author: PR

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but is a little small for a betta to live in
customer_reviews.text: Small for even a beta. I decided to put lettuce in mine instead of a house plant. The big rocks it comes with seem pointless, but I needed them to cover the bottom grate so the little rocks didn't fall through. So far so good. It's a simple design but made pretty well. DO NOT fill the water to the top. Betta's need to breathe air. They go to the top of the water to breathe, unlike most fish. Not having very good lucky growing anything.
customer_reviews.author: Rich J. Stip

customer_reviews.title: Good idea bad execution
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this container to work; however, after the second week I am losing faith. My fish is doing okay but swimming less and less each day. The water is needing to be changed every few days. If not the bottom fills with waste, food and roots. Not the most convenient, but workable. The plants life are where the main issues comes into play. I had two plants die one orchid and one mint. The plants wilted fast not long after being submerged. IT appears that the top portion of the aquaponic only allows the roots to go so far. I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: marques leonard

customer_reviews.title: killed my fish
customer_reviews.text: bad for my fish. I hadn't done enough research and they need much more space than this and they need proper air, filter, and heater! after it made my fish depressed and start to experience fin rot I quickly threw the tank out but I was too late and it died RIP charlie
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Good product, Not big enough for Beta
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product and received only once piece of it, contacted Amazon and was immediately sent another product two days later so was happy with that. After I put a beta in the tank and put a plant on top, I felt that it was too small for a beta fish. ended up taking the beta out and just using the product as a planter for the plant and put beta in a two gallon tank. Overall satisfied with product.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Sealey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love betas and I love gardening, but I was a bit concerned there wouldn't be enough nutrients for my plant to keep flowering, but after two weeks, the flowering is still budding and blooming like crazy. The beta seems happy, but the happiest is probably the cat who loves to stare at it (from a safe distance) for hours. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Romeyn

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are inaccurate. Betta can not live in this tank in the winter unless you live in a warm climate. It says the fish will eat from the plant roots and you don’t have to feed them. Not true. Tank needs to be cleaned at least twice a week. I admit, I should have researched this more and about caring for a Beta before buying. Very disappointed. Read the reviews on here. Very helpful!
customer_reviews.author: kmginpa

customer_reviews.title: Know your fish and plant combination that’s works good
customer_reviews.text: I love this idea but be careful which plants you put in with your fish they very well may be toxic to the fish and they may die quickly
customer_reviews.author: Shane Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Works as Pictured
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received was scratched & cracked; however, Amazon shipped out a replacement immediately, which was great. The only part I don't like is the opening where the peace lily roots go through is very narrow, so I literally used a crochet hook to pull some of the roots through. Works fine and my betta seems to be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Great addition
customer_reviews.text: I truly wish it was glass instead of plastic but I guess I could always just look for a glass container and just use the lid which is the real winner here, I usually make my water plants lid with anything I find which has been a pain in the butt. Overall I’m happy with this purchase and it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Yuni

customer_reviews.title: Great product with only one flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I love this betta tank. It looks great. My only issue is that it is super hard to get the plant roots through the bottom of the lid. I was able to get the few big ones through, but not the smaller ones. They are bunched up at the bottom and have no contact with the water. Hopefully it will survive.
customer_reviews.author: Lori W

customer_reviews.title: pretty great deal, my betta loves it.
customer_reviews.text: This set up was pretty cool and easy. It does NOT come with a plant. Rocks, cylinder tank and top plant holder with holes to let the roots go through. I ended up buying a bigger glass cylinder tank and using the topper on it.Over all, it was worth the money if you want the whole set up.
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: Make Sure your water is balanced!
customer_reviews.text: If you are new to aquaponics please do your research before placing fish in. Peace lily is your best option for a plant this can work if done right. Bettas do not need a lot of space so not sure why reviews say to small most betta tanks are about the same size and the fish love resting in the roots!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage..
customer_reviews.text: This is a scam. First of all you gave to keep the plant in sunlight which is contrary to fish environment and produces unimaginable algae growth . The idea is cute the concept is in practical.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: Use top with a larger container if you feel abd
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use the container it came with, just the top part with my own larger vase and it's great. Perfect for my desk at work
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Great little tank
customer_reviews.text: I just like it. Its a simple piece but, it functions well. Its in my office window which means I'm fighting algae but, as soon as I get the appropriate chemical agents for the water it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Dayton

customer_reviews.title: Aquaponic planter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little aquaponic planter. My peace lily looks beautiful in it. I would definitely not put a fish in it though, as it is too small for a fish, but love it as a planter! My moss balls look good in it, too.
customer_reviews.author: Marti Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Cute tank!  Perfect for desk at work!
customer_reviews.text: I have not added a plant on top yet. I did add very small live plants in the tank to aid in oxygenation for the fish. This is a super cute little tank. Perfect for my desk at work.
customer_reviews.author: CrunchyHippieMama

customer_reviews.title: VERY low maintenance!
customer_reviews.text: After the plant grew out its roots, I don't even have to change the water. The only thing I do is just feed the fish almost every day. People love to visit him at my desk in the office.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Bongard

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Looks well designed and executed. The top plant tray was what I was most worried about. More of the river rocks would have been nice, but it would work well with a more established plant. Planted a spearmint cutting that was rooting pretty well in water. Bought the new betta fish and supplies at Petco. All seems to be going great so far. My kids have enjoyed the fun new experiment.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: This is too small for a fish to Thrive.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased on impulse, really cool little tank. Then realizing once I got the fish there is no room for this fish to be free in her new home!! Please think before purchasing. Do your HOMEWORK! I am now headed to the pet store after this to purchase a tank and setup. Because I thought it looked cool and it was cheap. Now I am getting a bigger fish tank than I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Ligon

customer_reviews.title: Cute betta fish setup
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little aquaponics setup! It was perfect for my office space and I get lots of compliments on it! The only thing is that the rocks it comes with are pretty ugly but they stay moist pretty long for the plant to thrive. You can easily put cute jewels or something better looking over them
customer_reviews.author: Ruger & Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my desk at work
customer_reviews.text: Novel product, works great, betta & plant have both been happy for over a year. If using a potted plant, rinse the roots really, really well to avoid getting pot soil in the water.
customer_reviews.author: C Kole Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Type of plant might be important
customer_reviews.text: Fish don’t really have enough room to swim. To feed fish you have to take plant out — which becomes a hassle (water on counter, etc). My plant died within 3 days. I put a new herb plant - it didn’t make it. Hard to know why.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Waraksa

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but not sustainable
customer_reviews.text: My aquatic plant died quickly. I was unable to put a fish in there due to the size. I got aquatic snails for there but they did not last very long. S dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer p batty

customer_reviews.title: Best fish tank ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best fish tank ever! This tank is easy to clean as you just lift the plant base up. Once the roots grow well, just keep them trimmed so the beta can still swim easily and it keeps the tank relatively clean.
customer_reviews.author: T. In AK

customer_reviews.title: A Home for "Blu"
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Bought a plant from PetSmart for Bettas and it was already half dead so I'm returning the plant and will soon have another one for my "Blu"... But I did have it in there for awhile and he seemed to enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: QualityOverQuantity,Always!

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This product is really simple and cute. It was just what I needed. I didn’t add a fish to it I added sand and sea shells and put an air plant on top. It looks great and fits just about anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Swan

customer_reviews.title: No Fish
customer_reviews.text: It would be really cruel to put any fish in this. I bought it for Aquatic Isopods & seed shrimp. Thats what size things should go in this cup.
customer_reviews.author: KERI B

customer_reviews.title: Great for a baby BETA
customer_reviews.text: If you want a large fish this may simply be too small but for a baby he seems very happy and healthy hanging out in all the roots.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Speaker

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My step daughter demanded she have this tank, I got it, shipped fine, well packaged, easy to set up and clean. She loves it, her little fish n Cati love their home growing fine. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: jjo

customer_reviews.title: Tank is really small but I like it: ) I didn't put a fish in ...
customer_reviews.text: Tank is really small but I like it :) I didn't put a fish in it just have it on my window sill with the plant.
customer_reviews.author: Megan McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: On the smaller side but still love it
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely adore the idea of this tank and it looks great! However, I feel like it’s a little small, which makes it difficult to add anything inside of the tank. I was looking for a hideaway decoration for my betta and nothing was small enough to fit in the tank. opted for a leaf hammock instead
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Painter

customer_reviews.title: Great hydroponics entry gift
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made and the space is barely big enough for one guppy, but it is fun to use for growing.
customer_reviews.author: J-Reezy and the Wife

customer_reviews.title: The tank will suffocate your fish
customer_reviews.text: This tank is terrible. My fish died within hours of being put in there. The black part that the plant sits in is not very deep so in order to keep the roots submerged in water you must fill the tank to the top. This MURDERS the betta fish because they have no access to air. The black planter completely seals off any air flow to the tank and your betta will suffocate immediately. TERRIBLE SET UP.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Half gallon is plenty big for a beta fish. They do not need 5 gallons of water to survive. Plastic is cheap though
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Slim and perfect
customer_reviews.text: My bettas are thriving and so are the plants. I used pothos and peace lily. Perfect design just add some pebbles, betta & rooted plant cuttings
customer_reviews.author: Eric Alyanakian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fish!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchase was a gift, my niece loves it, perfect for showing fish along with plant, seems to keep water much cleaner longer
customer_reviews.author: Deborah B.

customer_reviews.title: My fish barely lasted a month in this thing. ...
customer_reviews.text: My fish barely lasted a month in this thing. Changed water frequently and did everything I could to save it. Now I just use it as a vase with the plant still on top, so it still has some use to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The tanks are too small. We use them only for when we change out the aquariums we eventually bought. And now my daughter is using them as a planter for her bell pepper and ivy plants.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Betta Death Trap
customer_reviews.text: Berta’s don’t have gills which mean they need to gulp air at the surface, with the 1/2 gallon tank the planter piece covers the entire opening. Putting enough water that the roots of the plant gets water will also block access for the Betta to get air. Reading other reviews about how their Berta’s died soon after being transferred to this tank I can see why.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KILLED MY BETA
customer_reviews.text: My fish died within 2 days of putting him in here. I had him for a year prior with no issues with him. It was actually my 3 year olds fish so he was pretty bummed. I feel bad not reading the reviews prior to buying it. I wanted something that would help keep the tank clean and having a plant sounded cute but turns out I basically suffocated him with this tank. Please save your fish and do not buy this tank.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Too small for beta but great for small fish.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute little fish tank and I love that it creates a little system with the plant routs. I don’t feel it is big enough for a beta but is perfect for a little fish my daughter has that survived a beta attack.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Tillman

customer_reviews.title: Bought two and pleantly pleased
customer_reviews.text: Go for it Considering a third, I purchased one as a gift as well.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREA-MARIE QUEEN

customer_reviews.title: Nice purchase for price.
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. The actual fish bowl was smaller than I hoped (yes, the measurements are in the details, I just suck with visualizing measurements). Still a decent purchase for the price. I ended up moving the top with my plant to a larger fish bowl. Still a good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ami Null

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a starter for my betta fish. He loves it! I’m growing bamboo and this works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: CAMI GARNER

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Wish there was an easier way to feed the fish, but he likes it so far. I put a little floral decoration in to add color and a resting place.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: This was good for the money, but it was not easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Great tank for a beta
customer_reviews.text: For everyone saying that the plant takes oxygen from the water you need to research the fact of plants fo not take in oxygen from anything since they breathe in CO2 anf reduce oxygen. Second, the tank is more than twice the size of the small container they are kept in all stores so how is it too small.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Perry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute. Waiting for my plant to settle in so I can add a small fish.
customer_reviews.author: Dora

customer_reviews.title: Good concept but not best option for fish habitat.
customer_reviews.text: I still use mine but without the fish. Betta's should really have a filtration system gor longer life.
customer_reviews.author: Ayesha

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase for price
customer_reviews.text: I love this tank! I bought a peace lily for the top and my betta lived in it while he was very little. Once my betta got a little bigger I did move him to a larger tank. This is too small for a full size betta. BUT my peace lily is flourishing. I added some sand, moss balls, and Crystals to the bottom and it's so cute!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, just right
customer_reviews.text: I like how clean it looks and instead of a real fish I got a fake one and no one knows the difference and the best thing is I don’t have to feed it. Everyone is happy.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Way too small to keep fish inside
customer_reviews.text: This is way too small to keep a fish inside. It’s fine if you want to use it to keep a plant in it but otherwise useless for fish.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Tank is too small for the fish
customer_reviews.text: I use my own glass vase. Looks much better now.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Yu

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected, the pic is misleading
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t come with a plant, there’s no English directions and the QR code on the paper doesn’t even work. Very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: We loved this so much that we have now bought three.
customer_reviews.author: Angie P

customer_reviews.title: Cruel
customer_reviews.text: Got this thinking that there would be more space and the water would oxygenate better. Any fish i put in here dies from lack of oxygen. No way should this be used for anything but plants.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Kinda small. Little difficult to get a plant to live on it.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal E.

customer_reviews.title: Check the water for the fish
customer_reviews.text: One fish died so you have to make sure to test the ammonia levels everyday. I thought the plant would balance the water toxicity. My plant was so big I had the make the opening much bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Auer

customer_reviews.title: Does not include a plant
customer_reviews.text: Does not include plant, which in my case was good cause I already had a bamboo plant.... waiting a few more days for things to settle before I add my beta fish
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy easy easy and cute
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old grandson. He loves it. He choose a bonsai tree and a beta fish. We clean the tank at least once a week, although it could go longer. Easy easy easy to clean and takes up very little space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In Love
customer_reviews.text: Simply beautiful, I'm very happy with my purchase, I keep it at work and every single patient enjoys it. Will recommend
customer_reviews.author: SID

customer_reviews.title: Look nice. Good for plant and fish.
customer_reviews.text: My fish seems happy so far; no need to clean too often.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea.
customer_reviews.text: This is so cute and easy to clean. We added some pebbles to the bottom and poked 2 bamboo stalks all the way to the bottom. Looks really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ivory M.

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: My fish died within less than 24 hours. I and just so sad my poor baby. I use lucky bamboo as the plant.
customer_reviews.author: BETH CALABRESE

customer_reviews.title: Plant is total nonexistent!!! Don't buy this item
customer_reviews.text: Plant doesn't grow.... my fish died. Then another fish died and now my snail is even dead. Wtf
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Get instant zen at your desk!
customer_reviews.text: Great aquarium for my desk at work! Everyone loves the work mascot! It was a tad hard to get plant roots thru base but my plant is growing like crazy!!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Lampson

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t come with rocks :/ like the box says. This has clearly been already opened
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT GOOD for ANY FISH
customer_reviews.text: A Betta deserves a 5 gallon minimum tank. I can't believe I actually bought this at one point and had a fish. Go to the Betta Fish Sub-Reddit Care Guide and it will explain all the basic requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Penn Plax Aquaponic Betta Fish Tank Promotes Healthy Environment for Plants and Fish
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Placed a lucky bamboo plant and gave it as a gift. They loved it. It not easy to clean. You have to make sure to rise the plant well so there no fertilizer on the plant that will make the fish I’ll.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great! Happy fish, happy plant, happy me!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little fish tank! It works great with my betta fish and a philodendron.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product! Great size, self explanatory and absolutley wonderful for the price! Ive bought several others that are similar but smaller and paid more.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT GET FOR FISH
customer_reviews.text: do NOT get this tank if you are getting it for a fish. I've only had it for a week and my betta died. granted it is on my end due to poor research, but learn from my mistake. DO NOT GET THIS FOR YOUR FISHY FRIEND. THEY WILL SUFFOCATE TO DEATH.
customer_reviews.author: Ash R

customer_reviews.title: Dead fish! Don’t buy! Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: I only had my fish living in the tank for 3 day’s and it died! Don’t buy this tank. Bamboo looks great but tour fish won’t survive.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Gave to my co workers very practical and great conversation piece.
customer_reviews.author: jshea

customer_reviews.title: No plant
customer_reviews.text: Thought I was ordering the plant not the vase. Vase is made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Bren

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super cute little aquarium but quickly realized my fish needed more space and upgraded soon after purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: JBR

customer_reviews.title: Good for plants not for fish
customer_reviews.text: I loved it when I got it, but my fish got its head stuck in the bottom of the part the plant goes into. I'm still going to use it for my water plant.
customer_reviews.author: jeanette parks

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: My package was missing the ceramic stones, so just a clear container with a lid. Please send me the planting media to complete my order.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Spangler

customer_reviews.title: Go green or go
customer_reviews.text: Great product it made a nice giftfor my sister when she got a new teaching job the high school kids loved it
customer_reviews.author: peter b.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to care for
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute idea. We have no issues with this tank so far. The tank is plastic( good for me)and comes with rocks to secure the plant in place. Both fish and plant are thriving.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plant is not reccomend, besides that nice office accessory
customer_reviews.text: The plant inside the container make it difficult for the fish to move around. Once I removed the plant my fish who would not swim became happy and would swim all day.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Mine didn’t have the rocks
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn’t come with the rocks to put in top that helps hold the plant up!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Mersberg

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: My experience was not a good one, on 2 separate my fish died pretty quickly. I’m not sure if they can’t get very much oxygen with the plant on top.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Alberts

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sister for her birthday. Although the bottom isn't really big enough for a fish it's still beautiful and a great decoration.
customer_reviews.author: ARIANNA

customer_reviews.title: Cute System

product_meta.title: Penn Plax Aquaponic Betta Fish Tank Promotes Healthy Environment for Plants and Fish .5 Gallon Capacity
product_meta.description:
This Penn Plax Aqua Ponic Betta Fish Tank 1.4 Gallon adds beauty to your home decor with or without fish. While creating a healthy environment for your fish. Made of high quality plastic, this betta fish bowl replicates nature’s natural metabolic cycle by allowing the fish waste to be absorbed by the plant above as nourishment. Plastic planting bowl includes ceramic substrate planting stones and is suitable for most indoor houseplants, herbs, and leafy vegetables. Plant helps to keep the betta tank clean and purifies the water. Betta tank measures 10 inches high and 8 inches in diameter and holds 1.4 gallons of water. Safe for use with a betta, small goldfish, bloodfin tetra, and white cloud minnow. Fish and plant are not included.

Additional information:
Most indoor house plants are suitable for the planting in the environment; suggestions include Chinese evergreen, English ivy, bamboo, mint, watercress, chives, or any leafy lettuce. Penn Plax recommends you research the plants toxicity and nutritional requirements before using as fish may nibble on roots. Plant is not a source of food for the fish. Any fish food can be used but avoid overfeeding as this can cloud water and harm both fish and plant. Betta tank is shown with a peace lily plant. Seeds are not recommended.
feature_bullets: Plastic plant holder with ceramic substrate planting material.
Planter can create a healthy habitat for betta fish by replicating nature's cycle.
Plant above purifies water and absorbs fish waste as nourishment.
Betta fish tank is easy to clean; planter is simple to remove when needed. Can be used as a planter alone for many water thirsty plants.
Recommended for betta, goldfish, bloodfin tetra, and white cloud minnow.
